meanings.definition: To last longer than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The old tortoise outlasted the speedy hare in the race.
meanings.sent2: The battery in my toy outlasted all the others.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner outlasted the rain and finished the race with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outlasted all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree outlasted generations of families, standing tall and strong.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be successful longer than expected.
meanings.sent1: The small business outlasted the big chain stores in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: His memory outlasted the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The little plant outlasted the harsh winter and bloomed beautifully in spring.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music outlasted any challenges she faced.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two outlasted all disagreements, growing stronger with each passing year.
